001.name: Old Man
001.text: Oh, my beautiful Josefa, why did you have to leave me so soon?

002.text: Hi! Have you heard about a nearby vending machine?

002.name: Old Man
002.text: Can't you see I'm mourning my wife? Don't bother me with that nonsense!

003.text: He doesn't seem to notice you. Is he deep in thought... or is it just poor eyesight?

004.name: Old Man
004.text: She was walking a boy's dog, and the wretched beast ran away. My wife went after it and a few hours later the dog came back, unharmed, while my wife was nowhere in sight.

005.name: Old Man
005.text: Later I found her, dead. The place was crawling with monsters, but I managed to bring back her body. She now rests dressed in her finest dress, with her beautiful family pendant at her neck.

006.name: Old Man
006.text: May I ask something of you?

027.text: Hold on. Were you talking about this trinket?

009.name: Old Man
009.text: You seem like a capable individual. Would you mind picking up a certain flower for me?

010.text: What's so special about this flower?

011.text: Why don't you get it yourself?

018.text: Actually, Raul Simao got one for you

010.name: Old Man
010.text: It's my late wife's favorite flower. I'd like to place it in her grave...

011.name: Old Man
011.text: I know where they grow, but the place's infested by vile creatures and I'm a frail, old man.

012.name: Old Man
012.text: Oh, thank you so much. Josefa would be so pleased!

002.text: Have you heard about a nearby vending machine?

004.text: Could you tell me about your wife again?

018.text: Actually, Raul Simao got one for you

015.name: Old Man
015.text: Be safe, I won't go anywhere!

017.name: Old Man
017.text: Thank you so much! You don't know how much this means to me... Here, this ain't much, but it's all I have!

018.name: Old Man
018.text: Really? That's so nice of him! Maybe I've been too harsh... It wasn't his fault, and the dog's too stupid to blame

019.name: Old Man
019.text: Pleased to see you! How can I help?

027.text: Hey, is this your wife's pendant?

020.text: Have you heard about a machine nearby?

020.name: Old Man
020.text: I don't know anything about that

022.name: Old Man
022.text: Thank you. I've been mad at him... Them, for too long. How can I help you?

027.text: Hey, is this your wife's pendant?

020.text: Have you heard about a machine nearby?

024.name: Old Man
024.text: That rotten bastard... And his beast... They will burn in hell!

030.text: Hey, is this your wife's pendant?

025.text: Have you heard about a machine nearby?

027.name: Old Man
027.text: You... You monster. Give it to me, that's not yours to take!

028.text: I am so sorry, here you go

028.name: Old Man
028.text: My poor Josefa's rest disturbed... I will never forgive you, begone!

029.name: Old Man
029.text: No! I won't let y... My heart... I can't..... (dies)

030.name: Old Man
030.text: What?! And you made me blame it all on poor Raul Simao?!

031.name: Old Man
031.text: Begone! I don't want to see you again!

001.name: Raul Simao
001.text: Hey, I'm Raul Simao, and this is my lovely dog, Spritz.

011.text: Hey, isn't that the dog who killed the old man's wife?

002.text: Get that mangy thing away from me

003.name: Raul Simao
003.text: Have you talked to Old Man Arnaldo?

004.name: Raul Simao
004.text: You don't know Old Man Arnaldo? He's that old man, down there.

005.name: Raul Simao
005.text: If he asks something of you, please come and see me.

007.name: Raul Simao
007.text: I hope you didn't come here to insult Spritz again...

008.name: Raul Simao
008.text: It depends. Do you still think Spritz is a "mangy thing"?

009.name: Raul Simao
009.text: Then I guess you wouldn't want that "mangy thing" following you around, would you?

011.text: He told me a dog got his wife killed.

012.text: He wants me to get him some sort of flower.

013.text: He wants me to get him his wife's favorite flower.

011.name: Raul Simao
011.text: It was not Spritz's fault. He only goes where people walk him, unless he's in danger. He came running back for help that day. Josefa probably didn't know of the monsters...

012.name: Raul Simao
012.text: He was probably talking about his wife's favorite flower...

013.name: Raul Simao
013.text: If I gave it to him, he might be willing to to hear me out and who knows, maybe forgive me...

014.name: Raul Simao
014.text: When you find it, could you bring it to me instead? I would be forever grateful!

023.text: I already have it. Here you go

022.text: I've already given it to Arnaldo

017.text: I'm not going to get the flower

015.name: Raul Simao
015.text: Thank you. Spritz and I will be here, friend!

016.name: Raul Simao
016.text: Oh... That's a shame. At least you'll help Arnaldo.

017.name: Raul Simao
017.text: I think you should reconsider. I'll be here if you do.

022.text: I've already given it to Arnaldo

019.name: Raul Simao
019.text: I'll be here if you change your mind.

020.name: Raul Simao
020.text: So, have you brought the flower?

022.text: I've already given it to Arnaldo

021.name: Raul Simao
021.text: Spritz and I will be waiting!

022.name: Raul Simao
022.text: That's a shame... At least Arnaldo is happy.

024.name: Raul Simao
024.text: Thank you so much! If you need anything, I'll be here, friend.

025.text: I don't think Arnaldo is ever going to forgive us, but at least you helped him...

026.text: I'm forever grateful. What do you need, friend?

027.name: Raul Simao
027.text: Of course, my friend! It's the least I can do after you helped me reconcile with Arnaldo!

028.name: Raul Simao
028.text: You didn't help me, but you kept your word to Arnaldo and gave him the flower, which means you keep your word.

031.text: The Gravekeeper needs help getting truffles

030.name: Raul Simao
030.text: Take care of Spritz and don't forget to bring him back when you're done. I don't know what I'd do without him!

031.name: Raul Simao
031.text: Dampere has a thing for truffles, so that's a legitimate reason!

032.name: Raul Simao
032.text: You weren't fond of him before, and I doubt you changed your mind...

033.name: Raul Simao
033.text: Dog's usually like treats, so you might be able to get YOUR OWN dog if you have some on you! Not Spritz, though, he already has an owner!

034.name: Raul Simao
034.text: Sorry, I don't trust you enough to lend you my dear Spritz.

036.text: I don't need him anymore, here you go

036.name: Raul Simao
036.text: Thank you. I hope he was able to help!

037.name: Raul Simao
037.text: No worries, just don't forget to bring him back!

038.name: Raul Simao
038.text: Do you need Fritz's assistance again?

001.text: The inscription reads: "In Loving Memory of Josefa, the sweetest soul that ever lived"

002.text: You remember the old man's mention of what you assume is a unique family pendant

003.text: You dig until you find Josefa's bones. You pry her pendant out of her neck.

004.text: Spritz happily digs, spraying earth everywhere, until he finds Josefa's bones. You pry her pendant out of her neck, while he happily chews on a bone.

005.text: You dig for a bit, until your nails hit earth that is no longer soft. You feel continuing without some sort of tool would be a waste of time.

006.text: You get out of the grave with some effort, due to the hole's size

007.text: It's hard to miss the hole you dug and, from where you stand, you can see Josefa's skeleton, covered in her tattered dress.

001.name: Friend
001.text: Hello, again. You're probably investigating the rumours about the area's machine too! No one knows if it's The Coffee Machine, but it's worth the try.

002.name: Friend
002.text: Problem is there is no way out. At least that I know of. I talked to a shady guy, to the east, offering some sort of deal to get me out, but It seemed too risky

003.name: Friend
003.text: I'll be here if you need me, and don't forget to tell me if you find a way out!

004.name: Friend
004.text: Hey! You're back with good news, I hope?

005.text: Got us a way out of here, but you need to hurry

006.text: I found a machine. No coffe, though

006.name: Friend
006.text: That's a shame... We still need to find a way out!

007.name: Friend
007.text: Well, I'll be here if you need me, and don't forget to tell me if you find a way out!

008.name: Friend
008.text: Don't worry about me, I'll be there on time

001.name: Abrotio Primao
001.text: Hey, you. Stuck here, right? I know way to get out, yes? You want?

002.name: Abrotio Primao
002.text: Very nice. I help, but first you give. Like unique valuable item, or dog seasoned with truffle.

003.text: Can't I get you anything else?

004.text: Sure... I'll see what I can do

005.name: Abrotio Primao
005.text: You no escape area without Abrotio, I guarantee.

006.name: Abrotio Primao
006.text: You bring what I ask? No deal other way.

008.name: Abrotio Primao
008.text: Is good, dog meat good with or no truffle

010.text: Yes, get me out of here

011.text: Wait, I haven't found the machine yet!

012.text: Wait, can I bring a friend with me?

011.name: Abrotio Primao
011.text: Fine. Find machine then back but fast

012.name: Abrotio Primao
012.text: No problem. Think I know guy just tell him to ready

013.name: Abrotio Primao
013.text: Oh my god what is this it? Tastes just like dog seasoned with truffle, very good!

001.text: Before you stands a vending machine. Unfortunately, it's a snack machine, not the one you're looking for. There's a coffee stain on it, however, and you cannot resist the urge to lick it. Somehow, you feel better!

002.text: When you approach the machine, your dog treat starts humming. A compartment extends, with the exact shape of the treat, and a screen with three options appears

003.text: You hear a loud THUNK, and then you retrieve the armor.

004.text: The machine spits out a blade, which somehow lands at your feet without hurting you.

005.text: A celestial tune playes while the chips are extracted within a special compartment, which is only inserted after you pick them up.
Pick the dog "seasoned with truffles" flavoured chips
